FuncDef: The reset nat user address-group section command deletes user information associated with a specified address segment in an address pool of a specified instance.
CLIs: reset nat user { nat-instance | dslite-instance } <instance-name> address-group <group-name> section <section-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Clears user information based on a NAT instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Clears user information based on a DS-LITE instance name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Deletes information about users with a specified instance-specific address pool.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Clears user information based on an address segment ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 15.

Examples: <HUAWEI> reset nat user nat-instance nat2 address-group address-group1 section 2
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To clear user information from a specified address segment in an address pool on a NAT instance, run the reset nat user address-group section command.
Precautions
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
